definition-item.definition-title: PREPARATION OR PRETREATMENT OF THE MATERIAL TO BE SHAPED; MAKING GRANULES OR PREFORMS; RECOVERY OF PLASTICS OR OTHER CONSTITUENTS OF WASTE MATERIAL CONTAINING PLASTICS

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The mechanical preparation of plastic material as raw material used in subsequent plastic shaping techniques which form a final product (B29B7/00, B29B9/00, B29B13/00 and B29B15/00).
The making of preforms used as an intermediate product which will udergo an additional processing step, e.g. blow moulding, to obtain the final product (B29B11/00).
The recovery of plastics from waste products in order to reuse it for making new products (B29B17/00).
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Methods, devices directed to the chemical aspects of the plastic preparation, pretreatment or recovery (e.g. chemical composition, use of specific additives, operating steps intended to modify the properties of the polymer, etc.)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Mixing in general
Granulating in general
Solid waste disposal

list-item.paragraph-text: In this subclass, it is desirable to add the Indexing Codes of subclasses B29K
Reference is further made to the special rule of classification in the field of B29B17/00 as far as the application of Indexing Codes as provided in B29L and B29K is concerned.

Products per se are not classified in this subclass. However, if a product is characterised by the way it is produced and not by its structure or composition, the production method should be classified in this subclass.

Inventive and additional information disclosed in documents to be classified should be identified by allocation the appropriate classification symbols provided in B29B. In particular attention should be paid to the so called break down Indexing Codes, forming a further subdivision of a group or a subgroup, which are only present at additional information level.

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: A plastic
is defined as a macromolecular compound or composition based on such a compound.
In a plastic state
refers to a state in which the material is more or less easily deformable, locally or as a whole, by force in any direction, to assume and retain any desired shape.

abbreviations.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following abbreviations are often used:

table-column.paragraph-text: Resins
Japanese patent applications usually refer to resins instead of plastics

definition-item.definition-title: Mixing; Kneading ({for preparation of dough A21C1/00;} in general B01F; combined with calendering B29C43/24, with injection B29C45/46, with extrusion B29C48/36)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Devices for the preparation of plastics, this preparation only concerning the mechanical aspects of it, i.e. the mixing of the individual components to obtain a homogeneous mass and/or its subsequent mechanical kneading to achieve the desired consistency.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Extrusion of plastics

section-body.paragraph-text: In this subclass, as a general rule, the type of plastic mixer is to be specified, as well as the specific structural elements which are characteristic of this kind of device.

Additional details of the mixing or kneading device for which no specific classification information can be found in B29B7/00 are classified under the corresponding sub-groups of B01F (mixing in general).

definition-item.definition-title: Making granules (in general B01J; chemical aspects C08J3/12)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

the mechanical preparation of granules, pellets made of plastic material as raw material and used in subsequent plastic shaping techniques which form a final product. The plastic materials concerned by this subclass are polymeric materials used in the subclasses B29C.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: The mechanical preparation of granules, pellets made of non-polymeric material
Medical preparations characterized by special physical form: particulate form, powder, granulates, microsphere, pellets
Making or treating expandable particles
Method of shaping (pelletizing, briquetting) of solid fuel made of vegetable substances (wood, forestry or agricultural wates)

definition-item.definition-title: by dividing preformed material

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cutting aspects of dividing the preformed material
Developers with toner particles; preparation methods

definition-item.definition-title: in the form of plates or sheets

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in B29B9/04.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Disintegrating by knives or other cutting or tearing members which chop material into fragments, specially adapted for disintegrating plastics

definition-item.definition-title: in the form of filamentary material, e.g. combined with extrusion

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in B29B9/06.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Disintegrating by knives or other cutting or tearing members which chop material into fragments, specially adapted for desintegrating plastics
Multi-port extrusion nozzles

definition-item.definition-title: {under-water, e.g. underwater pelletizers}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

The methods and devices for the preparation of granules, pellets made of plastic material as raw material wherein the cutting operation is performed right after extrusion in a water box. Underwater pelletizer includes also the use of other liquids to cool down the extruded plastic material.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in B29B9/065.

definition-item.definition-title: by agglomerating smaller particles

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in B29B9/08.

definition-item.definition-title: by moulding the material, i.e. treating it in the molten state

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

The methods and devices for the preparation of granules, pellets made of plastic material as raw material wherein no preformed material (e.g. plates, sheets, filamentary matrial as in B29B9/04 or B29B9/06) is used. The granules are made by moulding.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in B29B9/10.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Granulating material in general; by dividing the liquid material into drops, e.g. by spraying, and solidifying the drops
Granulating material in general; by dividing the liquid material into drops,in a gaseous medium
Granulating material in general; by dividing the liquid material into drops,in a liquid medium

definition-item.definition-title: characterised by structure or composition

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

The methods and devices for the mechanical preparation of granules made of plastic material as raw material wherein the granules are defined by their physical structure (e.g. multilayer or compartimentalized granule) or by their composition (e.g. the selection of the granule ingredients has an influence on the method and apparatus used to manufacture the granule).
The documents disclosing only the chemical composition of granules and wherein the mechanical preparation is absent or trivial are classified in C08J3/12.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in B29B9/12.

definition-item.definition-title: fibre-reinforced

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

The methods and devices for the preparation of granules, pellets made of plastic material as raw material wherein the granule comprises long fibres (fibres as long or longer than the granule), short fibres or fibrous material of different shapes.
The granules comprizing fillers (e.g. powder) are classified in B29B9/12.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in B29B9/14.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Pretreatment of reinforcement; coating or impregnating of reinforcements of indefinite length with a matrix in liquid form, e.g. as melt, solution or latex

definition-item.definition-title: Auxiliary treatment of granules

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The methods and devices for the after-treatment of granules, pellets made of plastic material (e.g. absorbing, coating, crystallizing, deforming, purifying).
The chemical aspect of the treatment of granules (e.g. post-polymerization, polycondensation) is classifiyed in C08.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in B29B9/16.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Macromolecular compounds obtained by reactions forming a carboxylic ester link in the main chain of the macromolecule
Solid-state polycondensation
Post-polymerisation treatment
Purification; Drying
Macromolecular compounds obtained by reactions forming a carboxylic amide link in the main chain of the macromolecule
Solid state polycondensation
Post-polymerisation treatment
Machines or apparatus for drying materials in loose, plastic, or fluidised form, e.g. granules, staple fibres, with progressive movement

definition-item.definition-title: Making preforms (B29C61/06 takes precedence {; combined with blow-moulding B29C49/02, with thermoforming B29C51/02; making preforms for manufacturing of light guides B29D11/00721})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preforms relating to B29 in general.
Preforms for blow-moulding bottles.
Making of preforms not otherwise provided for.
The making of preforms (process and apparatus) for which an entry is provided elsewhere, e.g. B29C, is not classified in B29B11/00 and its subgroups.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Preform
An object obtained by moulding substantially consisting of plastic material, which has to undergo an additional processing step, e.g. blow-moulding, to obtain its final shape

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

definition-item.definition-title: by dividing preformed material, e.g. sheets, rods

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: F-term (Japanese classification) related to manufacturing preforms by shredding preformed materials

definition-item.definition-title: by assembling preformed material

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Making preforms by assembling separate parts, e.g. making a perform for blow moulding by joining a separately moulded neck and thread portion with a separately moulded body portion.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Joining of preformed parts
F-term (Japanese classification) related to manufacturing preforms by assembling preformed materials

definition-item.definition-title: by moulding the material

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: F-term (Japanese classification) related to manufacturing preforms by moulding the materials

definition-item.definition-title: Injection moulding

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: F-term (Japanese classification) related to manufacturing preforms by injection moulding

section-body.paragraph-text: Injection moulding processes and devices for making preforms, whereby the alleged invention lies in the moulding technique as such, are classified in the moulding technique as such (B29C45/00) and not in this subgroup.

definition-item.definition-title: Extrusion moulding

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: F-term (Japanese classification) related to manufacturing preforms by extrusion moulding

section-body.paragraph-text: Extrusion moulding processes and devices for making preforms, whereby the alleged invention lies in the moulding technique as such, are classified in the moulding technique (B29C48/00) as such and not in this subgroup.

definition-item.definition-title: Compression moulding

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: F-term (Japanese classification) related to manufacturing preforms by compression moulding

section-body.paragraph-text: Compression moulding processes and devices for making preforms, whereby the alleged invention lies in the moulding technique as such, are classified in the moulding technique (B29C43/00) as such and not in this subgroup.

definition-item.definition-title: characterised by structure or composition

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preforms having a special composition or shape adapted for its further processing steps or use.

definition-item.definition-title: comprising fillers or reinforcement {(non-woven fabrics per se D04H1/00, D04H3/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Preforms having fillers/reinforcement where the purpose of subsequent moulding is mentioned
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Shaping composites
F-term (Japanese classification) related to: Preforms, including shaping thereof
F-term (Japanese classification) related to: Manufacturing preforms

definition-item.definition-title: Conditioning or physical treatment of the material to be shaped (chemical aspects C08J3/00 {; heating, cooling or curing during shaping B29C35/00; thermal after-treatment B29C71/02})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The methods and devices for the pre-treatment of the plastic material to be shaped prior to the moulding operation.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in B29B13/00.

definition-item.definition-title: {Treatment of sinter powders}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The methods and devices for the pre-treatment of powder plastic material prior to the process of sintering.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in B29B13/007.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sintering layers coated on a mould
Compression moulding; pressing and sintering powders, granules or fibres
Rapid manufacturing or prototyping of 3D objects; using layers of powder being selectively joined, e.g. by selective laser sintering or melting

definition-item.definition-title: {Heat treatment of powders}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The methods and devices for the pre-treatment of the plastic material to be shaped (powder, pellets, granules) by heating prior to the moulding operation.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in B29B13/021.

definition-item.definition-title: {Melting the material to be shaped}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The methods and devices for the heat treatment of the plastic material to be shaped (powder, pellets, granules) until said plastic material melts prior to the moulding operation.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in B29B13/022.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Storage, supply or control of liquid or other fluent material; provided with means for heating or cooling the liquid or other fluent material in the supplying means upstream of the applying apparatus

definition-item.definition-title: {Half-products, e.g. films, plates}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

The methods and devices for the pre-treatment by heating of the plastic material to be shaped, said plastic material typically being in the form of a film or plate. Said film or plate is a half-product as it has not yet undergone its final shaping operation.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in B29B13/023.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Heating preforms (film, sheet, plate) prior to thermoforming

definition-item.definition-title: {Hollow bodies, e.g. tubes or profiles}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in B29B13/024.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Heating a tubular preform prior to blow moulding
Ovens specially adapted for heating preforms or parisons

definition-item.definition-title: {Tube ends}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in B29B13/025.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Shaping of tube ends, e.g. flanging, belling, closing; Apparatus therefor

definition-item.definition-title: by cooling {(cooling moulded articles or half products B29C35/16)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in B29B13/04.

definition-item.definition-title: {of powders or pellets}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in B29B13/045.

definition-item.definition-title: by drying (B29B13/08 takes precedence {; drying moulded articles or half products B29C37/0092})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in B29B13/06.

definition-item.definition-title: {of powder or pellets}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in B29B13/065.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Machines or apparatus for drying materials in loose, plastic, or fluidised form, e.g. granules, staple fibres, with progressive movement

definition-item.definition-title: by using wave energy or particle radiation

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in B29B13/08.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Processes of treating or compounding macromolecular substances. Treatment by wave energy or particle radiation
Irradiation devices

definition-item.definition-title: by grinding, e.g. by triturating; by sieving; by filtering

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The methods and devices for the mechanical pre-treatment of the plastic material to be shaped by grinding prior to the moulding operation.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in B29B13/10.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Recovery of plastics or other constituents of waste material containing plastics. Disintegrating plastics (e.g. by milling)
Disintegrating by knives or other cutting or tearing members which chop material into fragments, specially adapted for disintegrating plastics

definition-item.definition-title: Pretreatment of the material to be shaped, not covered by groups B29B7/00 - B29B13/00

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The methods and devices wherein the material undergoes a pre-treatment operation that is an operation that modifies the material to be shaped e.g. by moulding.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in B29B15/00.

definition-item.definition-title: Coagulating devices

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The methods and devices wherein the material undergoes a coagulation operation prior to final shaping wherein the mechanical aspect of the method or device is detailed.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Treatment of rubber latex, coagulation
Treatment of polymer emulsions, coagulation

definition-item.definition-title: of reinforcements or fillers (chemical aspects C08J, C08K)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Surface modifications, normally chemical but also treatments like preheating or carving, of reinforcements or fillers typically to improve the adhesion with the matrix

definition-item.definition-title: {of reinforcement of definite length with a matrix in solid form, e.g. powder, fibre or sheet form (calendering B29C70/506)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Treatments of textile materials by liquids, gases or vapours
Artificial leather obtained by covering fibrous webs with macromolecular material

definition-item.definition-title: {with a matrix in liquid form, e.g. as melt, solution or latex}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Matrix in powder form
Matrix in the form of sheet

definition-item.definition-title: Recovery of plastics or other constituents of waste material containing plastics; ({volume reduction of waste plastics, e.g. by mechanical compacting or melting disposal of solid waste B09B;} chemical recovery C08J11/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Processes as well as the corresponding machinery for recovering plastics, as well as other constituents of waste material containining plastics
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Reuse of recycled material in moulding processes as such, e.g. in compression moulding

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: General arrangement of separating plants for refuse
Volume reduction of waste plastics other than plastic containers

section-body.paragraph-text: In this group including its subgroups, it is highly desirable to add the Indexing Codes B29K for the type of plastic material to be recycled, and the Indexing Codes B29L for the type of product to be recycled.

In this group including its subgroups, only the type of plastic material to be recycled shall be classified by the B29K Indexing Codes. Any non-recycled material, e.g. virgin material, which is added during the recycling process shall not be classified by such B29K Indexing Codes.

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

definition-item.definition-title: {Direct recuperation and re-use of scrap material during moulding operation, i.e. feed-back of used material}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Recycling processes, as well as the corresponing machinery, whereby the recovery of plastics is combined with the direct reuse of said material in a molding process.
Typical examples are:

list-item.paragraph-text: Re-use by regrinding the hardened runner/sprue and feeding it into the hopper of an injection moulding machine.
Re-use by regrinding or directly feeding the side-trim in plastic film extrusion to the hopper of the extruder.

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Recovery of starting material, waste material or solvents during the manufacture of artificial filaments or the like, made of synthetic polymers

definition-item.definition-title: {by agglomeration or compacting}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Dietetic products with reduced nutritive value, by addition of substantially indigestible substances, i.e. Cellulose or derivatives
Making particle boards or fibreboards, with preformed covering layer
Making discontinuous sheets of paper, pulpboard or cardboard, or of wet web, for fibreboard production

definition-item.definition-title: {of large particles, e.g. beads, granules, pellets, flakes, slices}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Making granules

definition-item.definition-title: {for shaping parts, e.g. multilayered parts with at least one layer containing regenerated plastic}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Recovery of plastics or other constituents of waste material containing plastics by an agglomeration or compacting process. The recovered material is used for shaping parts, e.g. compacting plastic waste particles in a heated compression mould for obtaining a discrete article. Possibly with the addition of a binding agent, i.e. urethane.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Destroying solid waste or transforming solid waste by agglomeration, binding or encapsulation using an organic binder or matrix
Layered products essentially comprising synthetic resin made from or containing mainly scrap material

section-body.paragraph-text: In this group, it is highly recommended to add additional classification in the shaping technique concerned, e.g. B29C43/00 for compression moulding, B29C45/00 for injection moulding.

definition-item.definition-title: {Compacting complete waste articles}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Recovery of plastics or other constituents of waste material containing plastics by an agglomeration or compacting process, whereby a complete wasted article is compacted, e.g. recovery of plastic containers, e.g. PET bottles by volume reduction.

definition-item.definition-title: {Hollow articles, e.g. bottles}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Presses specially adapted for consolidating scrap metal or for compacting used cars

definition-item.definition-title: Separating plastics from other materials

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Recovery of plastics or other constituents of waste material containing plastics whereby said recovered material is separated from other materials, e.g. one type of plastics, e.g. PE is seperated from another type of plastics, e.g. PA, by density separation in a water bath.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Separating by pneumatic tables or by pneumatic jigs
Wet separating by sink-float separation

definition-item.definition-title: {using local heating of the reinforcement}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Recovery of plastics or other constituents of waste material containing plastics whereby the matrix material is separated selectively from the reinforcements by destroying the interface bound before desintegrating the matrix to particles or powder using local heating of the reinforcement, e.g. heating of tires or conveyor belts, e.g. by induction heating, for softening the rubber matrix around the then hot steel wires.

definition-item.definition-title: Disintegrating plastics, {e.g. by milling} (B29B9/02, B29B11/02, B29B13/10, {B29B17/02} take precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Processes as well as the corresponding machinery for recovering plastics, as well as other constituents of waste material containining plastics, whereby the plastic material is disintegrated.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Disintegrating by knives or other cutting or tearing members which chop material into fragments
Especially adapted for disintegrating plastics, e.g. cinematographic films
For plastic bottles
Cutting through work characterised by the nature or movement of the cutting member; Apparatus or machines therefor; Cutting members therefor
Especially adapted for cutting rubber
For cutting used tyres

section-body.paragraph-text: In this group including its undergroups, it is highly desirable to add additional B29B2017/0424 Indexing Codes for the type of disintegrating technique.
